page.title: 01Hayle Area.
page.content: Hayle,a popular tourist resort,lies between Penzance and Camborne on the A30.Since last November it has had a by_pass. Hayle is situated in a river valley and is just above sea level.At high tide water floods into the estuary filling Hayle Pool.Evidence of its past can be found in its placenames such as Copperhouse and Foundry Square.Hayle has a very long beach, three miles of golden sands which is very popular with tourists.The older houses in Hayle are mainly terraced and built of granite.Many new housing estates comprise of detached or semi detached houses.To Hayle's north are sand dunes which protect it from the sea beyond.The remaining land is farm land,growing early crops and cereals. The population in 1982 was 6300.
